title: Dot matrix pixel face
content:
hi there,

does anyone know this font?

[http://www.ambient-terror.de/massive.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123610/http:/www.ambient-terror.de/massive.jpg "http://www.ambient-terror.de/massive.jpg")

many thanks,  
s

 [‹ (x) BancSoft logo - Arial, Ex Ponto {Lex, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123610/http:/typophile.com/node/32835 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) What is the meaning of the "e" symbol - "estimated" {Choz Cunningham} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123610/http:/typophile.com/node/32836 "Go to next forum topic")
author: saman

comments.content: thanks stephen - the alternative is still quite different to the example though. any other ideas?
And Ray Larabie also has a seriffed dotty called [Vactic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123610/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/vactic/regular/?refby=typographica).
You can also get close by adding a stroke to [FF Dot Matrix](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123610/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_dot_matrix/).
